      • login

        @PostMapping(value="/api/login")
 @ResponseBody
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity login(@RequestBody
                                                                                                       LoginData login,
                                                                                                       javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
        Logs in users
        Parameters:
        login - User credentials in the form of a LoginData object
        session - Session
        Returns:
        200 OK of credentials valid, 403 Forbidden otherwise

      • logout

        @GetMapping(value="/api/logout")
 @ResponseBody
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity logout(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Logs out users, terminates current session
        Parameters:
        request - Request object
        Returns:
        200 OK

      • register

        @PostMapping(value="/api/register")
 @ResponseBody
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity register(@RequestBody
                                                                                                             User newUser,
                                                                                                             javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
        Registers new users
        Parameters:
        newUser - Information for creating new user
        session - Session
        Returns:
        200 OK if successful, 409 conflict if anything goes wrong (i.e. username already exists)

      • getCurrentUser

        @GetMapping(value="/api/getCurrentUser")
 @ResponseBody
public User getCurrentUser(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
        Returns user object for current user
        Parameters:
        session - Session
        Returns:
        User object for current user containing name, username, email, and password
